SENT.plain: This report presents three families with Chiari malformation type I that became symptomatic during childhood: a mother and son; a set of monozygotic twins; and two half-siblings and their two maternal cousins
These children presented with various symptoms, including headache, stiff neck, and swallowing difficulty
A review of the relevant literature is presented, with an emphasis on familial examples and proposed inheritance
Less common presentations of Chiari malformation type I are discussed, as well as the possible pathogenesis of Chiari malformation type I and associated syringomyelia
